result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASES: 14CF106, 14CF155, 14CF156, 14CF304, 12TR3539, 12TR3540, 13TR913 & 14CV129. Defendant Lynn M Krueger in court with attorney T Gregory Amann.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 9:13 am.  9:38 am recess.  10:05-back on the record.  CT does not qualify for CIP.  Qualifies for subst abuse pgm.
SENTENCING RE: 14CF106 & 14CF155.
W/H sentence, prob on both counts, 3 yrs, concurrent.  $290.60 fine/costs on ea count.  150 hrs of CS/yr-total 450 hrs.  AODA & comply.  Comply w/ rules of probation.  COMPAS & comply.  $320 restitution-to PCSD-St Croix Valley Task Force.  Failure to pay costs-reduced to civil judgment.
14CF106-DNA sample.  No surcharge.  6 mo CT, serve 30 days up front, subj to WR no GT.  Remainder stayed for probation.  Must report to PCJ by 8/1/15.  Credit for 6 days if revoked, (as to both files).
Felon-no firearms, cannot vote, cannot hold elected office, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights, not elig for expungement.  No body armor.  PCR.  Must report to probation today.  
14CV129-DA-ask forfeit cash.  Amann-obj, asking for trial.  
14CF304-trial needed.  10:42 AM ADJ.
from Atty Amann to Judge Anderson requesting sentencing hearing be resch.  APPROVED 2/23/15.

Defendant Lynn M Krueger in court with attorney T Gregory Amann. Daniel P. Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Clerk KK.  9:15 AM.  CASES:  14CF106, 12TR3539, 12TR3540, 13TR913, 14CF155, 14CF156, 14CV129 and 14CF304.  This was a JT date.  Partial resolution.  Atty Amann gives resolution.   TR files are still pending.  14CF304 still open at this time.  Defendant enters plea of G to count 3 in 14CF106.  Defendant enters plea of NC to count 1 in 14CF155.  Atty Amann addresses CV file.  Court - Accepts both pleas and finds G to both charges.  Enters judgment in record on todays date.  14CF156 DRI.  14CF106 counts 1, 2 and 4 DRI.  May not vote until civil rights are restored, May not hold elective office - potential loss of other citizen rights.  May not possess/use firearms or body armor.  If not US citizen may face deportation and loss of other citizen rights.  Attys have 30 days to notify court of 14CV129 if not notified will take up at sentencing.  14CF304 still open.  PSI ordered.  Long form.  Agent does not need to be present - may be notified week in advance if that does change.  Compas eval.  PSI is due by 02/12/2015.  Bonds continues.  adj. 9:47AM  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
